summary: Amazon knows some customers are sharing Prime accounts beyond their households . The tech giant is trying to encourage individuals to get their own memberships . Netflix announced its intention to ban password sharing in May 2023 .  Ghani said he had nothing “official” to share on the issue of account sharing . Ghani added that Prime membership is “ purposely meant for household individuals living together”  Netflix has added 19 million users, increasing global paying membership by 41 million over the year prior . Revenue inQ125 hit $10.5 billion, up 12.5% year-on-year, and is expected to hit $11 billion byQ2 .  Amazon has less to gain or lose by changing its account policies than other models . Ghani outlined the plan for Prime at present is to encourage people to sign up for their own accounts . Amazon Family, for example, allows a customer to share their benefits with another adult and up to four children .  Ghani: “We’re relaunching the Prime young adult program which is all the benefits of Prime and more for folks that are [aged] 18 to 24.” With consumers battling an uncertain economic outlook, Ghani is to maintain value in customers’ eyes .

Netflix's planned take on the FTX saga spotlights Sam Bankman-Fried and Caroline Ellison’s involvement in the effective altruism movement . Anthony Boyle and Julia Garner are set to star in the show . The show has a link to the Obamas .  The title, "The Altruists," is a nod to Bankman-Fried's and Ellison’s involvement in the effective altruism movement . Effective altruism is a philosophy that seeks to identify and act on the best way to do the most good based on empirical evidence .  "The Imitation Game" writer Graham Moore and "The Good Wife" producer Jacqueline Hoyt will serve as co-showrunners . Anthony Boyle is set to star as Bankman-Fried, Julia Garner plays Ellison . The series is expected to have eight episodes .  FTX, at its peak, was the second-largest cryptocurrency exchange by volume . The exchange collapsed in November 2022 amid revelations of fraud and gross mismanagement . Garner is best known for her role in the hit Netflix series “Ozark,” which earned her three Emmy nominations .

Netflix, Inc. (NASDAQ:NFLX) delivers a wide range of TV shows, films, documentaries, and games through internet-connected devices . During a May 16 episode, Cramer said the following about the company: A home theater with family members enjoying streaming content together .

Netflix is one of the few technology stocks that didn't experience a sell-off during the initial tariff announcements in April . Netflix trades at a premium to other companies in streaming and entertainment, but management's long-term vision might justify that . Several catalysts could push its shares even higher in the second half of 2025 .  In theory, tariffs can lead to higher prices (inflation) for consumers, causing them to cut back on discretionary spending . However, Netflix offers viewers a number of subscription tiers based on price . In other words, it's unlikely that rising tariffs will lead to a wave of subscriber churn for Netflix .  Netflix stock is trading at an all-time high of roughly $1,222 per share . Over the last 10 years, Netflix has completely transformed its business from a platform featuring licensed content to one that's producing billions of dollars of original content .  Despite the premium valuation, I still see Netflix as a rock-solid buy, given its edge over the competition . Buying the stock at current prices will require patience, though . Its trajectory in the remainder of 2025 may be quite bullish, but even bigger gains are in store for long-term investors .
